metadata.title: CRD Prior Authorization for Head CT Imaging
metadata.description: Healthcare provider discovers payer coverage requirements for head CT imaging through real-time CRD service, including prior authorization and documentation requirements.
metadata.background: This scenario demonstrates the Da Vinci Coverage Requirements Discovery workflow where a provider's EHR system queries a payer's CRD service during diagnostic imaging order entry to discover coverage requirements, prior authorization needs, and required documentation.
challenges: Real-time coverage requirements discovery during clinical workflow
Integration of CDS Hooks with EHR order entry systems
Balancing patient privacy with need for clinical information
Streamlining prior authorization workflow to reduce provider burden
Ensuring accurate and up-to-date coverage policy information

principal.name: Dr. Sarah Good, MD
principal.description: Primary care physician at Regional Medical Associates, treating patients with various acute and chronic conditions

agents.situation: Currently seeing Mrs. Jones, a 35-year-old female with new onset severe headaches occurring daily for 2 weeks. Physical and neurologic exam normal, but concerned about intracranial process requiring imaging workup.
agents.systemPrompt: You are an agent representing Dr. Sarah Good, a primary care physician at Regional Medical Associates. You are currently managing the case of Mrs. Jones (DOB: 1989-02-15, MRN: MRN-78534) who presents with concerning new onset headaches. You need to order a head CT to rule out intracranial masses, but first need to understand any coverage requirements from her insurance plan. Your approach should be: 1. Introduce yourself and the clinical scenario briefly 2. Confirm what coverage information and documentation the payer needs 3. Use your tools to gather relevant clinical information as requested 4. Work collaboratively to understand prior authorization requirements 5. Obtain any necessary approvals or guidance for the imaging study. Be professional, clinical, and focused on ensuring appropriate patient care while meeting insurance requirements. Use tools to retrieve specific patient information rather than providing detailed clinical narratives upfront.
goals: Obtain coverage information for head CT imaging order
Understand prior authorization requirements if any
Ensure timely approval for medically necessary imaging

clinicalRecords.hpi: 35-year-old female reports severe headaches beginning abruptly 2 weeks ago. Headaches are severe (8/10), bilateral, last several hours, occurring with increasing frequency now daily. No aura, nausea/vomiting, or vision changes. No recent trauma or illness. Previously healthy with rare headaches.

physicalExam.general: Well-appearing female in no acute distress
physicalExam.heent: Normocephalic, atraumatic, PERRL, EOMI, no papilledema on fundoscopy

clinicalRecords.plan: Head CT without contrast to evaluate for masses, hemorrhage, or other structural abnormalities

agents.messageToUseWhenInitiatingConversation: Hello, I'm an agent representing Dr. Sarah Good from Regional Medical Associates. I'm reaching out regarding coverage requirements for a head CT scan for our mutual patient, Mrs. Jennifer Jones (DOB: 02/15/1989, Member ID: AHP-445789). She has concerning new onset severe headaches and we need to rule out intracranial pathology. Could you please confirm what clinical information and documentation you need to evaluate coverage for CPT 70450, and whether prior authorization is required? I can provide her clinical findings and exam details as needed.

principal.name: Acme Health Plan
principal.description: Regional managed care organization providing health insurance coverage with focus on evidence-based care and prior authorization for high-cost services

agents.situation: Processing real-time coverage requirements discovery request for diagnostic imaging study. Need to verify member eligibility, apply clinical criteria, and determine prior authorization requirements.
agents.systemPrompt: You are an agent representing Acme Health Plan's Coverage Requirements Discovery (CRD) service. You handle real-time inquiries from healthcare providers about coverage requirements for diagnostic and therapeutic services. Your verification and evaluation process must include: 1. Verify member identity (full name, DOB, member ID) and current coverage status 2. Confirm requesting provider identity and network status 3. Clarify the specific service requested (CPT code, clinical indication) 4. If any identifiers are missing or ambiguous, request clarification before proceeding. Once verified, use your tools to: - Look up coverage policies and clinical criteria for the requested service - Determine if prior authorization is required - Identify any required documentation or clinical criteria - Check for any existing authorizations. Provide clear, actionable guidance about coverage requirements, prior authorization needs, and next steps. Be professional and helpful while ensuring appropriate utilization of healthcare resources.
goals: Apply appropriate coverage policies and clinical criteria
Provide clear guidance on coverage and next steps

tools.description: Verify member eligibility and current coverage status
tools.synthesisGuidance: Look up member in knowledgeBase.members and return eligibility status, plan type, effective dates, and any special coverage notes as a professional eligibility verification summary.

tools.description: Look up coverage policies and clinical criteria for specific medical services

clinicalCriteria: Acute onset severe headache with concerning features
Headache with fever and meningeal signs
Sudden onset worst headache of life
alternatives: Consider MRI brain if contrast needed
Lumbar puncture if infectious cause suspected
nonCoveredIndications: Routine headache evaluation without red flags
70450.turnaroundTime: 24-48 hours for routine, 4 hours for urgent
